title: Quarto template
text:
This is a Quarto template for multi-language website.
R example: Quick summary and plot


Summary
Plot




Codelibrary(ggplot2)
summary(cars)

     speed           dist       
 Min.   : 4.0   Min.   :  2.00  
 1st Qu.:12.0   1st Qu.: 26.00  
 Median :15.0   Median : 36.00  
 Mean   :15.4   Mean   : 42.98  
 3rd Qu.:19.0   3rd Qu.: 56.00  
 Max.   :25.0   Max.   :120.00  





Codeggplot(cars, aes(speed, dist)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method = "loess", formula = "y ~ x")







Python example: Polar Axis
For a demonstration of a line plot on a polar axis, see Figure 1.

Codeimport numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

r = np.arange(0, 2, 0.01)
theta = 2 * np.pi * r
fig, ax = plt.subplots(
  subplot_kw = {'projection': 'polar'} 
)
ax.plot(theta, r)
ax.set_rticks([0.5, 1, 1.5, 2])
ax.grid(True)
plt.show()



Figure 1: A line plot on a polar axis



Observable JS example: Palmer Penguins

Codedata = FileAttachment("./data/palmer-penguins.csv").csv({ typed: true })







Codeviewof bill_length_min = Inputs.range(
  [32, 50], 
  {value: 35, step: 1, label: "Bill length (min):"}
)
viewof islands = Inputs.checkbox(
  ["Torgersen", "Biscoe", "Dream"], 
  { value: ["Torgersen", "Biscoe"], 
    label: "Islands:"
  }
)
















Codefiltered = data.filter(function(penguin) {
  return bill_length_min < penguin.bill_length_mm &&
         islands.includes(penguin.island);
})







CodePlot.rectY(filtered, 
  Plot.binX(
    {y: "count"}, 
    {x: "body_mass_g", fill: "species", thresholds: 20}
  ))
  .plot({
    facet: {
      data: filtered,
      x: "sex",
      y: "species",
      marginRight: 80
    },
    marks: [
      Plot.frame(),
    ]
  }
)

You can create a link to an external website using absolute path. Find a detailed markdown syntax at Mardown Guide.
You can add a link to another pages in your site with a relative path: see about.

title: Editing
About
text:
This is a Quarto website.
Quarto enables you to weave together content and executable code into a finished document. To learn more about Quarto websites visit https://quarto.org/docs/websites.
